intro: Echium alonsoi, commonly known as the Canary Island fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the Canary Islands. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually hairy and lance-shaped, while its stems are erect and often branched. Echium alonsoi plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing nectar for pollinators.
